short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: A web extension that explains any text in a foreign language available on your screen.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Connect with ChatGPT and learn languages while browsing the web.

Reading translations of words in your target language is not enough to really understand it.

Mastery of a language involves understanding context, grammar, formality, and syntax, as well as vocabulary.

With BrowserTranslate, you can link your ChatGPT account and read breakdowns of passages you encounter while browsing the web.

All you need to do is highlight the desired text, press the translate button that appears, and a popup with the relevant info will appear.

You'll learn:

- Translations
- Vocabulary
- Romanization (if the language is not in a latin script)
- Grammar
- Syntax
- Formality

So how many languages does BrowserTranslate support?

BrowserTranslate currently supports over 100 languages, from the major dialects of Chinese and Arabic to prominent languages in Europe, Africa, and Asia.

This includes:

- Spanish
- Italian
- Russian
- Farsi
- Arabic (Egyptian, Lebanese, Saudi, Moroccan)
- Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese, Hokkien, Hakka, Shanghainese, Taiwanese)
- Japanese

+ many, many more.

If you want to accelerate your language learning while browsing the web, download BrowserTranslate for a cheap one-time fee and use it indefinitely.

(Note: BrowserTranslate is a paid product - pay $9.99 and access the product indefinitely. Access to the plugin also requires a ChatGPT account, users must provide their own API keys. We've put together a guide to make this as quick and easy as possible.)
